Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 20TH DYNASTY ?; 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Lid of a canopic jar
Description: This canopic jar lid in terracotta comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Abydos. It takes the form of a canine head, painted entirely in black and decorated by yellow lines indicating the eyebrows, the eyes, the ears and the wig. The example, which is in a good state of preservation, belongs to a type of lid of a canopic jar dating from the 20th Dynasty.
